comments:
I have upgrade to Eclipse 3.1 from 3.0 and my VE crashes when I try to open it.

Any ideas as to what I have done wrong?

Best regards,
  Marc

---------------stack trace-----------------------------------

Your viewer is trying to lookup a null item. When we do the hash we get an NPE.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Your viewer is trying to lookup a null item. When we do the hash we get an NPE.

Okay, you have shown that you have a keen sense of the blooming obvious. Now
show us how my java code could kill your editor?  
1.) If the editor comes across an error in my code it should react with more
grace than just barfing up on the screen.

2.) "org.eclipse.jface" is not my class and I don't know or care to know how it
works it just should work.

3.) Who is placing object in CustomHashtable (not I) and why do they assume that
the object of interest is in the hashtable? Maybe there should be a
"pessimistic" scenario and not the current "optimistic" currently implemented.

4.) The VE worked in Eclipse 3.0, what could have gone wrong? 

5.) Does any one else have this problem? 

Here is some food for thought.

Thanks for your time,
  Marc

This is an update viewer that is having the issue.

You need to go a little further down the trace to see where the item is being
updated - one of the children is null. One of the issues we have is trying to
blance performance and safety which is why we do this in a SafeRunnable.

BTW what do you mean by VE?

(In reply to comment #3)
> This is an update viewer that is having the issue.
> 
> You need to go a little further down the trace to see where the item is being
> updated - one of the children is null. One of the issues we have is trying to
> blance performance and safety which is why we do this in a SafeRunnable.
> 
> BTW what do you mean by VE?

The VE is the Visual Editor.  I have created the class using the Visual Editor
to create a GUI.  By the way here is a bit more information, I notice that a
class is not being found:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/draw2d/ConnectionRouter

Any idea why this class can not be resolved, am I missing some updated version?

OK that explains my confusion - Eclipse doesn't supply the Visual Editor - that
is from GEF.

The error you are showing is from
org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage - I suspect it is an error
that we caught and put to your log earlier and that the Visual Editor has a
problem it is not logging.

If you rename the .log file and try to start your workbench again do you get the
same error trace?

(In reply to comment #5)
> OK that explains my confusion - Eclipse doesn't supply the Visual Editor - that
> is from GEF.
> 
> The error you are showing is from
> org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage - I suspect it is an error
> that we caught and put to your log earlier and that the Visual Editor has a
> problem it is not logging.
> 
> If you rename the .log file and try to start your workbench again do you get the
> same error trace?

Yes I do. Here is all that is in the new log file.

Actually this is a different trace Marc - this is no ClassDefErrors found when
trying to restore your workbench because it can't find the GEF editors. Do you
have GEF installed in your 3.1 install?

The NullPointerException from CustomHashtable is not in your second trace.

(In reply to comment #7)
> Actually this is a different trace Marc - this is no ClassDefErrors found when
> trying to restore your workbench because it can't find the GEF editors. Do you
> have GEF installed in your 3.1 install?
> 
> The NullPointerException from CustomHashtable is not in your second trace.

My bad, your right its a differnet trace.
I'm a little confused. I look at may feature details and I have 

Eclipse Graphical Editing Framework
Version: 3.1
Build id: 200507071758

but if I look at Plug-in Details I have
Graphical Editing Framework 3.1 and Graphical Editor Framework 2.0
is this correct?

looking at the configuration details I see the following

org.eclipse.gef (3.1.0) "Graphical Editing Framework" [Active]
org.eclipse.gef (2.0.0) "Graphical Editor Framework" [Resolved]

It looks like you have GEF installed twice. How are you installing it? I think
if you got rid of the 2.0 GEF you might be alright - I'm not sure though.

Eclipse.
